pages.text: I've happened upon a world beyond our origin. It's incredible to think that despite the overworld being vast and infinite, there are yet more worlds to explore.$(br2)I'm curious what magick these worlds have to offer.
I will use this section of my journal to record my findings of each dimension I come across with unique magical properties.

pages.title: Aether
pages.text: Far above the world in a sea of clouds of $(thing)Water$(), this world where $(thing)Sun$() is eternal is filled with $(thing)Air$() and sparse of land.$(br2)$(thing)Arcane Energy$() permeates the air, bringing $(thing)Balance$() to the $(thing)Life$() that resides here.

pages.title: Nether
pages.text: Deep beneath the $(thing)Earth$(), this hell of $(thing)Fire$() and $(thing)Death$() where $(thing)Souls$() rest is filled with $(thing)Chaos$() and $(thing)Disintegration$().$(br2)Noticeably, this world is set in an eternal $(thing)Night$().

pages.title: Beneath
pages.text: Just under the $(item)Arcane Barrier$() is a vast $(thing)Earthy$() world filled with $(thing)Poison$() and $(thing)Darkness$().$(br2)Prolonged exposure might drive one's $(thing)Mind$() insane.$(br2)The $(thing)Water$() seems to contain $(thing)Ordered$() traces of magick.

pages.title: End
pages.text: This open-$(thing)Air$() world lacks $(thing)Water$() and $(thing)Fire$(), filled with strange creatures capable of teleportation.$(br2)I've heard tales that this race of $(thing)Illusive$() creatures hold the $(thing)Knowledge$() of $(thing)Creation$() itself.

pages.title: Twilight Forest
pages.text: This ever-$(thing)Dusk$() world lacks $(thing)Day$() and is filled with all sorts of $(thing)Natural$() and intriguing life.$(br2)From the $(thing)Strength$() and $(thing)Fire$() of $(thing)Dragons$(), to the $(thing)Transformative Fae$(), there is much magick and mystery to learn about.
